reviews.text: My wife and I were looking for a place to spend the night on our way to San Fran from Vancouver. Despite its questionable curbside appeal, the front desk staff was friendly and our room was super clean and appointed with a modern TV and bedding. Some pre-packaged breakfast items were available in the morning. We stayed mid-week in March for about $49 US, which was a great deal for this town. I highly recommend this hotel for an overnight stay.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here last minute from the AAA No. Calif Book we had with us on a recent road trip. The $60.00 per night for two inc. taxes was a great deal. King bed, clean and no wierd smells. Newly redone it appeared. My husb. has traveled alot and said this had the best shower ever! No AC but the windows opened.Did not try the heater as not needed for our stay.
reviews.title: Great Value-Clean
You can do better
reviews.text: This Travelodge has seen better days. It needs a major renovation which I don't believe the new owners will see to.

The room my family had was an upstairs room with two gueen beds. It had a disagreeable odor. But the worst thing was the water. With the hot water completely on and the cold completely off the water was lukewarm. Uncomfortable to shower in and worse to shave with.
reviews.title: Cheap, clean, accept pets
loving it...
reviews.text: Also we had to ask for two more towels since there were four of us. When we called the desk they wanted us to come there (at night) to get them. They did bring them when we said that we were already undressed.

Rooms were clean but the heater didn't work. the pictures were not hung securely. I opened the door and shook one picture off the wall. the glass shattered into hundreds of pieces, luckliy no one was injured. the motel clerk was quite nice, and very concerned when I told him. I am sure this is not a normal occurance, but thought it should be mentioned.
reviews.title: seemed to have safety issues

reviews.text: Clean, but very small room. Unfortunately the motel is on Rte 101, so lots of road noise. The worst part of the room, though, was a very unpleasant shower - too low, too much water pressure and it left every surface in the bathroom wet.
reviews.title: Aging, but not very gracefully

reviews.text: Traveling cross country, we arrived at this establishment late in the day. Seedy area. Window would not lock. Screen had been pulled out. Door didn't lock securely. Room adequately clean. No air conditioning. Worst stay on the six week trip.
reviews.title: Lock the door
